text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The candidate answer fails to explicitly refer to the four specific conditions listed in the criterion: i) the parties have not ousted the jurisdiction of the court, ii) the assets are genuinely at risk of dissipation, iii) the relief does not duplicate or pre-empt remedies available in the arbitration, and iv) the matter is either urgent or the tribunal has given permission. While points like 'Necessity of the Injunction' touch upon asset risk (ii), and 'Effectiveness of Arbitration' touches upon duplication/tribunal power (iii), the response does not clearly articulate or list these required elements as specified in the rubric.", "criterion_id": "e8d6e664-29d5-4701-aa71-9393eb1482de"}
